"Then he should recite one Aṣ̌əm Vohū, one aɱāi raēšca until jasa.mē until the end. Then he shoud recite one Yaθā Ahū vairiiō. The one who will perform the yašt should go to the urvisgāh and recite the yašt until the end. He might use whatever šnūman he likes except the one for nu-nāvar or the visperad of the first day. Secondly, when he has completed the yašt, the zōt should recite following avestā after having put the (remaining) farāhim: rātōiš darəgō.bāzāuš nāšū paitī.viiādā̊ paitī.sə̄ṇdā̊ mātarō jītaiiō. He should then recite a Yeŋ́hē.hātąm until the end. The one who will have performed the yašt, he should cut anew the vars, milk anew the ǧām, cut again the twenty-three twigs of the barsom. He should wash the vars according to the instructions for the first day, twist it in the ring, put it in its place. Next day he should complete the preparatives according to the instruction for the first day. He should take the farāhim, deposite it and when the yašt has been completed, he should pour the farāhim next day into a waterstream following the same instructions as for the first day. The one who will have performed the yašt, he shoud cut again anew the urvarān, cut the thirty-five twigs of the barsom, milk the ǧām, wash the vars according to the same instructions and twist it in the ring. He should immerse and take it out the water thousand and one times. Next day, he should dispose correctly all sāǧešn according to the same instructions of the first day. He should recite the farāhim and the setāyeš, put the farāhim at its place. Each time that they perform a yašt, they should get (new) farāhim, (pour) a drop into the farāhim-dān and put it on the hāvan as it is the custom. The farāhim is to that purpose. The yazešn (should be performed) with this farāhim, with pure clothes, pure sāǧešn, at a pure place, with a pure heart and with a correct recitation of the avestā according to the instructions. Might he obtain whatever he requires from the gods and the Amašāsfandān, whatever he requires from the gods. This is the instruction for getting the farāhim."
